kodkod.cli

Class KodkodServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • kodkod.cli.KodkodServer

  • public final class KodkodServer
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a server interface to Kodkod. A KodkodServer can be used either in batch or online mode. In batch more, a set of problem specifications is read from a file and parsed into a sequence of problems. Any commands that are specified for a given problem are executed as soon as the problem is constructed and before subsequent problems are parsed. Once all problems have been processed, the batch process exits. The process may also terminate early due to parsing, construction or solving errors. All diagnostic and error messages are logged to the global logger, to which a ConsoleHandler is added at the beginning of a server session. Solutions are printed to the standard output stream using StandardKodkodOutput.

    In online mode, the server receives problems from the standard input stream. Each batch of problems must be terminated by the end-of-input non-character 'ï¿¿'. When a batch of (one or more) problems is received, it is processed as described above. The process exits abnormally if an error is encountered. Otherwise it waits for the next batch of problems and continues processing them until it receives the (Exit) command. In that case, it exits normally regardless of whether there is any input after the first (Exit) command. The server also exits normally if its input stream is closed by the caller.

    The kind of problem specifications accepted by a KodkodServer instance depends on whether the instance is executing in incremental or standard mode. When running in incremental mode, the server can accept and solve a sequence of partial problems that make up a complete specification, analogously to an incremental SAT solver. The server accepts additions to the specification until it encounters the (clear) command. At that point, it resets its state to expect a new (incremental) problem specification. For more details on Kodkod's support for incremental solving, see the IncrementalSolver documentation.

    When running in standard mode, the server accepts and solves only complete problem specifications. This mode is more efficient, supports minimal core extraction, and should be used when incremental solving is not needed by client code.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KodkodServer

        public KodkodServer(boolean incremental,
                    boolean fastParsing,
                    java.lang.String errorOut)
        Creates a new KodkodServer that will write solutions to a StandardKodkodOutput instance. The solving and parsing modes are determined by the given flags. If the incremental flag is on, the server will execute in incremental mode; otherwise it will run in standard mode. If the fastParsing flag is on, the server will use a fast parser that will not output any information about parsing errors, except that they occurred. With the flag off, the solver will use a slower parser that will report detailed parsing errors. The errorOut parameter, if not false, specifies the name of the file to which to dump error-causing input, if any, before exiting.

    • Method Detail

      • serve

        public void serve(InputBuffer batch)
        Parses and executes the batch of problems specified by the given input buffer.

      • serve

        public void serve()
        Parses and executes problems received from the standard input stream until it reaches the end of the stream or receives a problem with the Exit command, whichever comes first.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Creates and executes an instance of KodkodServer. Run java kodkod.cli.KodkodServer -help for usage options.
